conbody.p: The variables in the message text and subject are either replaced by the entire TCP message or by the values of keys defined in the TCP message.

If $[content] is present in the message or subject of the template, then NS replaces it with the entire TCP message (excluding the Client-Type). If a generic variable is defined (for example, $[Cliemt-Type]), then NS replaces it with the value of the key as defined in the TCP message.

table.title: Example: variable replacement for TCP interface

entry.codeph: The client $[Client-Type] sent the following message: $[content].
Client-Type=SurePay#Type= Device#Entity-Id=dev_ 100#EVT=BALTOOLOW #MSISDN=1234567890# TEXT=Your credit of 0.50 is not enough to call. To recharge, call 141 or go to the mobile app.

The client SurePay sent the following message: Type=Device#Entity-Id=dev_100 #EVT=BALTOOLOW #MSISDN=1234567890 #TEXT=Your credit of 0.50 is not enough to call. To recharge, call 141 or go to the mobile app.
